lines.gurmukhi: 1 gurmuKwN dy l`Cx
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK hovY swDsMgu horqu sMig kusMig n rcY
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Hovai Saadhasangu Horatu Sangi Kousangi N Rachai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The person having attained the status of Gurmukh in the holy  congregation does not mix up with any bad company.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK pMQu suhylVw bwrh pMQ n Kycl KcY
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Pandu Suhaylarhaa Baarah Pand N Khaychal Khachai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The way (life) of  Gurmukh is simple and enjoyable; he does not enrapt himself with the  concerns of the twelve sects (of yogis).

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK vrn Avrn hoie rMg surMgu qMbol prcY
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Varan Avaran Hoi Rang Surangu Tanbol Parachai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukhs go beyond the castes,  colours and go about in equanimity like the red colour of betel leaf.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK drsnu dyKxw iCA drsn prsx n srcY
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Darasanu Daykhanaa Chhia Darasan Parasan N Sarachai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukhs behold the Guru's school and put no faith in six Schools (of  Indian tradition).

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK inhcl miq hY dUjy Bwie luBwie n pcY
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Nihachal Mati Hai Doojay Bhaai Loubhaai N Pachai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukhs have steadfast wisdom and do not waste  themselves in the fire of duality.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK sbdu kmwvxw pYrI pY rhrwis n hcY
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Sabadu Kamaavanaa Pairee Pai Raharaasi N Hachai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukhs practise the (Guru) shabad and  never forsake the exercise of touching the feet, i.e.they never abandon  humility.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK Bwie Bgiq chmcY ]1]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Bhaai Bhagati Chahamachai ?1?

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukhs abound in loving devotion.

lines.gurmukhi: 2 gurmuKwN dy l`Cx

Shabad OS B.translation: Attributes of Gurmukhs-the Guru oriented

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK ieku ArwDxw ieku mn hoie n hoie duicqw
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Iku Araadhanaa Iku Man Hoi N Hoi Douchitaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Gurmukhs single-mindedly adore the Lord and do not remain in  dubiety.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK Awpu gvwieAw jIvnu mukiq n qwms ipqw
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Aapu Gavaaiaa Jeevanu Moukati N Taamas Pitaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: By leaving away ego they become liberated and do not allow the  darkness (ignorance) to reside in their heart.

lines.gurmukhi: gur aupdys Avys kir sxu dUqw ivKVw gVu ijqw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Oupadaysu Avaysu Kari Sanu Dootaa Vikharhaa Garhu Jitaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Wrapt in the teachings of the  Guru, they conquer the fort (of body) including the five evils.

lines.gurmukhi: pYrI pY pwKwku hoie pwhunVw jig hoie AiQqw
lines.transliteration_english: Pairee Pai Paa Khaaku Hoi Paahounarhaa Jagi Hoi Aditaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: They fall at  the feet, become like dust (i.e.lowly), consider themselves as guests in  the world and are respected by the world.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK syvw gurisKw gurisK mw ipau BweI imqw
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Sayvaa Gur Sikhaa Gurasikh Maa Piu Bhaaee Mitaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukhs serve the Sikhs  considering them their parents, brothers and friends.

lines.gurmukhi: durmiq duibDw dUir kir gurmiq sbd suriq mnu isqw
lines.transliteration_english: Duramati Doubidhaa Doori Kari Guramati Sabad Surati Manu Sitaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Having given up  illwill and dubiousness, they merge their consciousness in the Word and  teachings of Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: Cif kuPkVu kUVu kuiDqw ]2]
lines.transliteration_english: Chhadi Kudhakarhu Koorhu Kudhitaa ?2?

Shabad OS B.translation: They set aside frivolous argument, falsehood and bad  deeds.

lines.gurmukhi: 3 gur isK sihcwrIAwN dw diRStwNq

Shabad OS B.translation: Companions of Gurmukhs

lines.gurmukhi: Apxy Apxy vrn ivic cwir vrn kul Drm DrMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Aapanay Apanay Varan Vichi Chaari Varan Kul Dharam Dharanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: In their own varnas all the people (of the four varnas) observe the tradition  of their caste and tribe.

lines.gurmukhi: iCA drsn iCA swsqRw gur gurmiq Ktu krm krMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Chhia Darasan Chhia Saasatraa Gur Guramati Khatu Karam Karanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: The believers in the books of the six schools  perform six duties according to the wisdom of their respective spiritual  mentors.

lines.gurmukhi: Apxy Apxy swihbY cwkr jwie juhwr juVMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Apanay Apanay Saahibai Chaakar Jaai Juhaar Jurhanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Servants go and salute their masters.

lines.gurmukhi: Apxy Apxy vxj ivic vwpwrI vwpwr mcMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Apanay Apanay Vanaj Vichi Vaapaaree Vaapaar Machanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Merchants deal profusely  in their own special merchandise.

lines.gurmukhi: Apxy Apxy Kyq ivic bIau sBY ikrswix bIjMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Apanay Apanay Khayt Vichi Beeu Sabhai Kirasaani Beejanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: All the farmers sow different seeds in  their different fields.

lines.gurmukhi: kwrIgir kwrIgrw kwirKwny ivic jwie imlMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Kaareegari Kaareegaraa Kaarikhaanay Vichi Jaai Miladay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Mechanics meet their fellow mechanics in the  workshop.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq gurisK pujMdy ]3]
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Gurasikh Pujanday ?3?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, the Sikhs of Guru, associate themselves with the  company of the holy persons.

lines.gurmukhi: 4 sihcwrIAwN dw diRStwq

Shabad OS B.translation: Example of the companions

lines.gurmukhi: AmlI rcin AmlIAw soPI soPI mylu krMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Amalee Rachani Amaleeaa Sodhee Sodhee Maylu Karanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: The addicts mix-up with addicts and abstainers with the abstainers.

lines.gurmukhi: jUAwrI jUAwrIAw vykrmI vykrm rcMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Jooaaree Jooaareeaa Vaykaramee Vaykaram Rachanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: The  gamblers mix up with gamblers and scounderls with scounderls.

lines.gurmukhi: corw corw iprhVI Tg Tg imil dys TgMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Choraa Choraa Piraharhee Tdag Tdag Mili Days Tdaganday.

Shabad OS B.translation: The love  abounds among the theives and the cheats who getting together, dupe the  country.

lines.gurmukhi: mskirAw imil mskry cuglw cugl aumwih imlMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Masakariaa Mili Masakaray Chougalaa Chougal Oumaahi Miladay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Jesters meet jesters enthusiastically and so do the backbiters.

lines.gurmukhi: mnqwrU mnqwrUAw qwrU qwrU qwr qrMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Manataaroo Manataarooaan Taaroo Taaroo Taar Taranday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Unknown to swimming meet similar persons and swimmers by meeting  swimmers go and get across.

lines.gurmukhi: duiKAwry duiKAwirAwN imil imil Apxy duK ruvMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Doukhiaaray Doukhiaariaan Mili Mili Apanay Doukh Ruvanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: The afflicted meet the afflicted ones and  share their sufferings.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq gurisKu vsMdy ]4]
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Gurasikhu Vasanday ?4?

Shabad OS B.translation: Likewise, the Sikhs of the Guru feel pleasure in the  holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: 5 hor siRStI qy gurmuKwN dw Prk

Shabad OS B.translation: Difference between Gurmukh and others

lines.gurmukhi: koeI pMifqu joiqkI ko pwDw ko vYdu sdwey
lines.transliteration_english: Koee Panditu Jotikee Ko Paadhaa Ko Vaidu Sadaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Someone is called pandit, someone astrologer, someone priest and some  physician.

lines.gurmukhi: koeI rwjw rwau ko ko mhqw cauDrI AKwey
lines.transliteration_english: Koee Raajaa Raau Ko Ko Mahataa Chaudharee Akhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Someone is called the king, satrap, headman and chaudhary.

lines.gurmukhi: koeI bjwju srwPu ko ko jauhrI jVwau jVwey
lines.transliteration_english: Koee Bajaaju Saraaphu Ko Ko Jauharee Jarhaau Jarhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Someone is draper, someone is called goldsmith and someone a jeweller.

lines.gurmukhi: pwswrI prcUnIAw koeI dlwlI ikris kmwey
lines.transliteration_english: Paasaaree Parachooneeaa Koee Dalaalee Kirasi Kamaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Someone is earning through being druggist, retailer and an agent.

lines.gurmukhi: jwiq snwq shMs lK ikrq ivriq kir nwau gxwey
lines.transliteration_english: Jaati Sanaat Sahans Lakh Kirati Virati Kari Naau Ganaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: (So  called) Low born are millions whose names explain their professions.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq gurisiK imil Awsw ivic inrwsu vlwey
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Gurasikhi Mili Aasaa Vichi Niraasu Valaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The  Sikh of the Guru, being in the holy congregation, while living in joys  remains indifferent to desires.

lines.gurmukhi: sbdu suriq ilv AlKu lKwey ]5]
lines.transliteration_english: Sabadu Surati Liv Alakhu Lakhaaay ?5?

Shabad OS B.translation: He by merging his consciousness in the  Word (sabad) beholds the Supreme Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: 6 hor siRStI qy gurmuKwN dw Prk

Shabad OS B.translation: Difference between Gurmukh and others

lines.gurmukhi: jqI sqI icru jIvxy swiDk isD nwQ gur cyly
lines.transliteration_english: Jatee Satee Chiru Jeevanay Saadhik Sidh Naad Gur Chaylay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Many are the celebates, the abiders of truth, the immortal ones, the siddhs,  nathas, and the teachers and the taughts.

lines.gurmukhi: dyvI dyv irKIsurw BYrau KyqRpwl bhu myly
lines.transliteration_english: Dayvee Dayv Rikheesuraa Bhairau Khaytrapaal Bahu Maylay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Many are the goodesses, gods, rsis, bhairavs and the protectors of the regions.

lines.gurmukhi: gx gMDrb ApCrw ikMnr jC cilq bhu Kyly
lines.transliteration_english: Gan Gandharab Apachharaa Kinnar Jachh Chalit Bahu Khaylay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Many are the gans  (ghosts), gandharvs (celestial singers), nymphs, and kinnars who perform  differently.

lines.gurmukhi: rwKs dwnoN dYq lK AMdir dUjw Bwau duhyly
lines.transliteration_english: Raakhas Daanon Dait Lakh Andari Doojaa Bhaau Duhaylay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Imbued with duality, many are the raksasas, the demons and  the giants.

lines.gurmukhi: haumY AMdir sB ko gurmuiK swDsMgiq rs kyly
lines.transliteration_english: Haoumai Andari Sabh Ko Guramoukhi Saadhasangati Ras Kaylay.

Shabad OS B.translation: All are controlled by the ego and the Gurmukhs take pleasure  in the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: iek mn ieku ArwDxw gurmiq Awpu gvwie suhyly
lines.transliteration_english: Ik Man Iku Araadhanaa Guramati Aapu Gavaai Suhaylay.

Shabad OS B.translation: There they, accepting the Guru's wisdom, shed  away their selfhood.

lines.gurmukhi: clxu jwx pey isir qyly ]6]
lines.transliteration_english: Chalanu Jaani Paay Siri Taylay ?6?

Shabad OS B.translation: (In India while going to get married the girl applies  oil to her hair and understands well that now she is going to leave her  parental home) Similarly Gurmukhs always having oil applied to their  heads are ever ready to depart from this world.

lines.gurmukhi: 7 jgq dy ruJyvyN qy gur Sbd

Shabad OS B.translation: The obsessions with the world and the Guru word

lines.gurmukhi: jq sq sMjm hom jg jpu qpu dwn puMn bhuqyry
lines.transliteration_english: Jad Sat Sanjam Hom Jag Japu Tapu Daan Pounn Bahoutayray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Hypocrisy by and large enters into the praxis of continence, burnt offerings, feasts, penances and gifts.

lines.gurmukhi: iriD isiD iniD pwKMf bhu qMqR mMqR nwtk Aglyry
lines.transliteration_english: Ridhi Sidhi Nidhi Paakhand Bahu Tantr Mantr Naatak Agalayray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Incantations and spells ultimately  turn out to be hypocritical plays.

lines.gurmukhi: vIrwrwDx jogxI mVHI mswx ivfwx Gnyry
lines.transliteration_english: Veeraaraadhan Joganee Marhhee Masaan Vidaan Ghanayray.

Shabad OS B.translation: The worship of the fifty-two heroes, of the eight yoginis of cemeteries and of places of cremation leads to  whopping dissimulation.

lines.gurmukhi: pUrk kuMBk ryckw invlI krm BuieAMgm Gyry
lines.transliteration_english: Poorak Kounbhak Raychakaa Nivalee Karam Bhuiangam Ghayray.

Shabad OS B.translation: People are obsessed with the pranayam exercises of the inhalation, suspension of breath, the exhalation, the niolr feat and  straightening of kundalini the serpent power.

lines.gurmukhi: isDwsx prcy Gxy hT ingH kauqk lK hyry
lines.transliteration_english: Sidhaasan Parachay Ghanay Hatd Nigrah Kaoutak Lakh Hayray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Many employ themselves in  sitting in the siddhasanas and thus we have seen them seeking myriad miracles.

lines.gurmukhi: pwrs mxI rswiexw krwmwq kwlK AwnHyry
lines.transliteration_english: Paaras Manee Rasaainaa Karaamaat Kaalakh Aanhayray.

Shabad OS B.translation: The belief in the philospher's stone, the jewel in the serpent's  head and the miracle of life immortalising elixir are nothing but the  darkness of ignorance.

lines.gurmukhi: pUjw vrq aupwrxy vr srwp isv skiq lvyry
lines.transliteration_english: Poojaa Varat Oupaaranay Var Saraap Siv Sakati Lavayray.

Shabad OS B.translation: People are engaged in the worship of idols of gods  and goddesses, in fasting, uttering and giving blessings and curses.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq gur sbd ivxu Qwau n pwiein Bly Blyry
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Gur Sabad Vinu Daau N Paaini Bhalay Bhalayray.

Shabad OS B.translation: But  without the holy congregation of the saints and the recitation of the Guru- sabad even the very good person cannot find acceptance.

lines.gurmukhi: kUV iek gMFI sau Pyry ]7]
lines.transliteration_english: Koorh Ik Ganddhee Sau Dhayray ?7?

Shabad OS B.translation: The  superstitions bind themselves with a hundred knots of falsehood.

lines.gurmukhi: 8 saux Sgn qy gurmuKqw

Shabad OS B.translation: Good and bad omens and the Gurmukh

lines.gurmukhi: saux sgun vIcwrxy nau giH bwrh rws vIcwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Saoun Sagoun Veechaaranay Nau Grih Baarah Raasi Veechaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The life led in the light of omens, the nine planets, the twelve signs of the  zodiac;

lines.gurmukhi: kwmx tUxy AausIAw kxsoeI pwswr pswrw
lines.transliteration_english: Kaaman Toonay Aouseeaa Kanasoee Paasaar Pasaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Incantations, magic divination by lines and by the voice is all  futile.

lines.gurmukhi: gdhu kuqy iblIAw iel mlwlI igdV Cwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Gadahu Koutay Bileeaa Il Malaalee Gidarh Chhaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Cries of donkeys, dogs, cats, kites, blackbirds and jackals cannot  control our lives.

lines.gurmukhi: nwir purKu pwxI Agin iCk pd ihfkI vrqwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Naari Purakhu Paanee Agani Chhik Pad Hidakee Varataaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: It is superstitious to draw good or bad omens from  meeting a widow, a bare headed man, water, fire, sneezing, breaking wind,  hiccups;.

lines.gurmukhi: iQiq vwr BdRw Brm idswsUl shsw sYswrw
lines.transliteration_english: Diti Vaar Bhadraa Bharam Disaa Sool Sahasaa Saisaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Lunar and week days, lucky-unlucky moments and going or not  going in a particular direction

lines.gurmukhi: vl Cl kir ivsvws lK bhu cuKI ikau rvY Bqwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Valachhal Kari Visavaas Lakh Bahu Choukhee Kiu Ravai Bhataaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: If a women behaves like a prostitute and  does every thing to please everybody, how can she be loved by her  husband.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Pl pwr auqwrw ]8]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Paar Outaaraa ?8?

Shabad OS B.translation: The gurmukhs who reject all superstitions enjoy happiness with  their Lord and get across the world-ocean.

lines.gurmukhi: 9 gurmuK mwrg dI pwvnqw

Shabad OS B.translation: Holiness of the Gurmukh way of life

lines.gurmukhi: ndIAw nwly vwhVy gMig sMig gMgodk hoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Nadeeaa Naalay Vaaharhay Gangi Sangi Gangodak Hoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Rivers and small streams joining Ganges become the sacred river  (Ganges).

lines.gurmukhi: Ast Dwqu iek Dwq hoie pwrs prsY kMcnu soeI
lines.transliteration_english: Asat Dhaatu Ik Dhaatu Hoi Paaras Parasai Kanchanu Soee.

Shabad OS B.translation: With the touch of the philosopher's stone (paras) all the mixed  light metals are transformed into gold.

lines.gurmukhi: cMdn vwsu vxwspiq APl sPl kr cMdnu goeI
lines.transliteration_english: Chandan Vaasu Vanaasapati Aphal Saphal Kar Chandanu Goee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The vegetation whether fruit producing or fruitless becomes sandal by assimilating into it the fragrance  of sandal.

lines.gurmukhi: iCA ruiq bwrh mwh kir suJY suJ n dUjw koeI
lines.transliteration_english: Chhia Routi Baarah Maah Kari Sujhai Sujh N Doojaa Koee.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the six seasons and twelve months nothing except sun is  there.

lines.gurmukhi: cwir vrin iCA drsnw bwrh vwt BvY sBu loeI
lines.transliteration_english: Chaari Varani Chhia Darasanaa Baarah Vaat Bhavai Sabhu Loee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Four varnas, six Schools of philosophy and twelve sects of the  yogis are there in this world.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK drsnu swDsMgu gurmuiK mwrig duibDw KoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Darasanu Saadhasangu Guramoukhi Maaragi Doubidhaa Khoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: But by treading the path of Gurmukhs all the dubieties of the above sects vanish.

lines.gurmukhi: iek min iek ArwDin EeI ]9]
lines.transliteration_english: Ik Mani Iku Araadhani Aoee ?9?

Shabad OS B.translation: They (Gurmukhs) now with stable  mind adore the One (Lord).

lines.gurmukhi: 10 kulwDrm qy gurmuK mwrg

Shabad OS B.translation: Family customs and the way of Gurmukh

lines.gurmukhi: nwnk dwdk swhurY ivrqIsur lwgwieq hoey
lines.transliteration_english: Naanak Daadak Saahurai Virateesur Lagaait Hoay.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the house of maternal grandfather, the father-in-law and the  grandfather, many a priest and servant exist.

lines.gurmukhi: jMmix Bdix mMgxY mrxY prxy krdy Foey
lines.transliteration_english: Janmani Bhadani Manganai Maranai Paranay Karaday Ddhoay.

Shabad OS B.translation: They carry the messages on  births, the mundan (shaving of head) ceremonies, betrothals, marriages and  deaths

lines.gurmukhi: rIqI rUVI kul Drm cj Acwr vIcwr ivKoey
lines.transliteration_english: Reetee Roorhee Kul Dharam Chaju Achaar Veechaar Vikhoay.

Shabad OS B.translation: They are seen working for the family duties and customs.

lines.gurmukhi: kir krqUiq ksUq ivic pwie dulIcy gYx cMdoey
lines.transliteration_english: Kari Karatooti Kousoot Vichi Paai Duleechay Gain Chandoay.

Shabad OS B.translation: On  occasions such as the sacred thread ceremonies, they through many tricks  make the master spend lavishly and tell him about his fame reaching the  skies.

lines.gurmukhi: joD jTyry mMnIAin sqIAw sauq toBVI toey
lines.transliteration_english: Jodh Jatdayray Manneeani Sateeaan Saout Tobharhee Toay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Deluded by them people worship departed heroes, ancestors, satis,  deceased co-wives, tanks and pits, but all this is of no avail.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq gur sbd ivxu mir mir jMmin deI ivgoey
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Gur Sabad Vinu Mari Mari Janmani Daee Vigoay.

Shabad OS B.translation: They who  enjoy not the holy congregation and the word of Guru, die and are born  again and are rejected of God.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK hIry hwir proey ]10]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Heeray Haari Paroay ?10?

Shabad OS B.translation: It is the follower of the Guru, i.e. Gurmukh  who wears (God's name as his) diamond necklace.

lines.gurmukhi: 11 Swhzwdy rwj kMvr

Shabad OS B.translation: Princes

lines.gurmukhi: lskr AMdir lwfuly pwiqswhw jwey swhjwdy
lines.transliteration_english: Lasakar Andari Laadulay Paatisaahaa Jaaay Saahajaaday.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the armies of emperors the dear princes also move.

lines.gurmukhi: pwiqswh AgY cVin ipCY sB aumrwau ipAwdy
lines.transliteration_english: Paatisaah Agai Charhani Pichhai Sabh Oumaraau Piaaday.

Shabad OS B.translation: The emperor leads  and the satraps and infantry follow.

lines.gurmukhi: bix bix Awvin qwiePy Eie shjwdy swd murwdy
lines.transliteration_english: Bani Bani Aavani Taaidhay Aoi Sahajaaday Saad Muraaday.

Shabad OS B.translation: The courtesans well-dressed come  before all but the princes remain simple and straight.

lines.gurmukhi: iKjmiqgwr vfIrIAin drgh hoin KuAwr kuvwdy
lines.transliteration_english: Khijamatigaar Vadeereeani Daragah Honi Khuaar Kuvaaday.

Shabad OS B.translation: The (true) servants  of the kings earn applause but the defiants get humiliated in the court.

lines.gurmukhi: A`gY FoeI sy lhin syvw AMdir kwr kuswdy
lines.transliteration_english: Agai Ddhoee Say Lahani Sayvaa Andari Kaar Kousaaday.

Shabad OS B.translation: In  the court (of the Lord) only they get shelter who remain rapt (in the  service).

lines.gurmukhi: pwiqswhwN pwiqswhu sy gurmuiK vrqY gur prswdy
lines.transliteration_english: Paatisaahaan Patisaahu So Guramoukhi Varatai Gur Parasaaday.

Shabad OS B.translation: With grace of the Lord, such gurmukhs become king of kings.

lines.gurmukhi: swh suhyly Awid jugwdy ]11]
lines.transliteration_english: Saah Suhaylay Aadi Jougaaday ?11?

Shabad OS B.translation: Only such people ever remain happy and contented.

lines.gurmukhi: 12 hor diRStwNq

Shabad OS B.translation: More examples

lines.gurmukhi: qwry lK AnHyr ivic cViHAY suiJ n suJY koeI
lines.transliteration_english: Taaray Lakh Anhayr Vichi Charhhiai Sujhi N Sujhai Koee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Myraid stars exist in the darkness but with the rise of the sun no one  remains visible.

lines.gurmukhi: sIih buky imrgwvlI BMnI jwie n Awie KVoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Seehi Boukay Miragaavalee Bhannee Jaai N Aai Kharhoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Before the roar of the lion, flocks of deers take to their  heels.

lines.gurmukhi: ibsIAr grVY ifiTAw KufI viVdy lK ploeI
lines.transliteration_english: Biseear Gararhai Ditdiaa Khudee Varhiday Lakh Paloee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Seeing the large vulture (garur) the snakes crawl into their holes.

lines.gurmukhi: pMKyrU swhbwj dyiK Fuik n hMGin imlY n FoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Pankhayroo Saahabaaj Daykhi Ddhouki N Hanghani Milai N Ddhoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Seeing a hawk, the birds fly helter skelter and do not find place to hide.

lines.gurmukhi: cwr vIcwr sMswr ivic swDsMgiq imil durmiq KoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Chaar Veechaar Sansaar Vichi Saadhasangati Mili Duramati Khoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: In  this world of conduct and thought, in the holy congregation one gives up  evil-mindedness.

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur scw pwiqswhu duibDw mwir mvwsw goeI
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Sachaa Paatisaahu Doubidhaa Maari Mavaasaa Goee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The true Guru is the true king who obliterates dilemma,  and, evil propensities hide or vanish.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK jwqw jwxu jxoeI ]12]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Jaataa Jaanu Janoee ?12?

Shabad OS B.translation: The Gurmukhs diffuse their  knowledge among others (and they are not selfish people).

lines.gurmukhi: 13 gwfI rwh gurmuK mwrg

Shabad OS B.translation: The Sikh highway-gadirah

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur scw pwiqswhu gurmuiK gwfI rwhu clwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Sachaa Paatisaahu Guramoukhi Gaadee Raahu Chalaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The true Guru, the real emperor has put the Guru-oriented (gurmukh) on  the high road ( of liberation).

lines.gurmukhi: pMij dUiq kir BUq vis durmiq dUjw Bwau imtwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Panji Dooti Kari Bhoot Vasi Duramati Doojaa Bhaau Mitaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He restrains the deadly sins, the five evil  inclinations and the sense of duality.

lines.gurmukhi: sbd suriq ilv clxw jmu jwgwqI nyiV n AwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Sabad Surati Livi Chalanaa Jamu Jaagaatee Nayrhi N Aaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukhs spend their lives while  keeping their heart and mind attuned with the sabda (word) and therefore  death, the tax-gatherer does not approach them.

lines.gurmukhi: bymuK bwrh vwt kir swDsMgiq scu KMfu vswieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Baymoukhi Baarah Vaat Kari Saadhasangati Sachu Khandu Vasaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Guru had dispersed the apostates into the twelve sects (of the yogis), and seated the holy  congregation of the saints in the domain of Truth (the sachkhand).

lines.gurmukhi: Bwau Bgiq Bau mMqR dy nwmu dwnu iesnwnu diRVwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Bhaau Bhagati Bhau Mantr Day Naamu Daanu Isanaanu Drirhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: By the  spell of the Nam, the gurumukhs have inculcated love, devotion, fear,  charity and ablutions.

lines.gurmukhi: ijau jl AMdir kml hY mwieAw ivic audwsu rhwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Jal Andari Kamal Hai Maaiaa Vichi Udaasu Rahaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The gurmukhs keep themselves unaffected by the  evils of the world as the lotus remains unwet in water.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpu gvwie n Awpu gxwieAw ]13]
lines.transliteration_english: Aapu Gavaai N Aapu Ganaaiaa ?13?

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukhs efface  their individuality and do not pose to assert themselves.

lines.gurmukhi: 14 scw soihlw

Shabad OS B.translation: The true engagement

lines.gurmukhi: rwjw prjw hoiekY cwkr kUkr dyis duhweI
lines.transliteration_english: Raajaa Parajaa Hoi Kai Chaakar Kookar Daysi Duhaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: By becoming subject of a king, people as servants go around the countries  to abide orders.

lines.gurmukhi: jMmidAw ruixJuMJxw nwnk dwdk hoie vDweI
lines.transliteration_english: Janmadiaa Rounijhounjhanaa Naanak Daadak Hoi Vadhaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: On the birth of a child felicitatory songs are sung in the houses of the maternal and paternal grandfathers.

lines.gurmukhi: vIvwhw no isTxIAw duhI vlI duih qUr vjweI
lines.transliteration_english: Veevaahaa No Sitdaneeaa Duhee Valee Dui Toor Vajaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: On marriage occasions  the songs are sung by woman in scurrilous language and trumpets are  played on the part of the bride and bridegroom (but not so among the  gurmukhs).

lines.gurmukhi: rovx iptxu muieAwN no vYx Alwhix Dum DumweI
lines.transliteration_english: Rovanu Pitanu Muiaa No Vainu Alaahani Dhoum Dhoumaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Weepings and wailings are there for the dead;

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq scu soihlw gurmuiK swDsMgiq ilv lweI
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Sachu Sohilaa Guramoukhi Saadhasangati Liv Laaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: But the  gurmukhs (the Guru-oriented) recite the Sohila in the company of the saints on such occasions.

lines.gurmukhi: byd kqybhu bwhrw jMmix mrix Ailpqu rhweI
lines.transliteration_english: Bayd Kataybahu Baaharaa Janmani Marani Alipatu Rahaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Sikh (gurmukh) goes beyond the holy books  of the Hindus and Muslims i.e. the Vedas and the Katebas, and neither rejoices at a birth nor mourns at a death.

lines.gurmukhi: Awsw ivic inrwsu vlweI ]14]
lines.transliteration_english: Aasaa Vichi Niraasu Valaaee ?14?

Shabad OS B.translation: In the midst of desires he  remains free from them.

lines.gurmukhi: 15 gurmuK mnmuK

Shabad OS B.translation: The Guru-oriented

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK pMQu suhylVw mnmuK bwrh vwt iPrMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Pandu Suhaylarhaa Manamoukh Baarah Vaat Dhiranday.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Guru-oriented move upon the simple and straight way and the mind- oriented (manmukh) go astray on twelve ways (the twelve sects of the  Yogis).

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK pwir lMGwiedw mnmuK Bvjl ivic fubMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Paari Laghaaidaa Manamoukh Bhavajal Vichi Doubanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: The gurmukhs get across whereas the manmukhs get drowned in  the world-ocean.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK jIvn mukiq kir mnmuK iPir iPir jnm mrMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Jeevan Moukati Kari Manamoukh Dhiri Dhiri Janami Maranday.

Shabad OS B.translation: The life of gurmukh is the sacred tank of liberation and  the manmukhs go on transmigrating and suffering the pangs of life and  death.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu pwiedy mnmuK duK Plu duK lhMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Paaiday Manamoukhi Doukh Phalu Doukh Lahanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: The gurmukh is at ease in the court of the Lord but the manmukh  has to bear (pain of) the rod of yama, the god of death.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK drgh surKrU mnmuiK jmpuir fMf shMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Daragah Surakharoo Manamoukhi Jam Puri Dandu Sahanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: The gurmukh is at ease in the court of the Lord but the manmukh  has to bear (pain of) the rod of yama, the god of death.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK Awpu gvwieAw mnmuK haumY Agin jlMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Aapu Gavaaiaa Manamoukhi Haoumai Agani Jaladay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The gurmukh  forsakes ego whereas manmukh burns himself continuously in the fire of  egotism.

lines.gurmukhi: bMdI AMdir ivrly bMdy ]15]
lines.transliteration_english: Bandee Andari Viralay Banday ?15?

Shabad OS B.translation: Rare are the people who though being in the limits (of maya) yet  remain immersed in His meditation.

lines.gurmukhi: 16 suhwgx dy rUpk ivc gurisK

Shabad OS B.translation: The woman

lines.gurmukhi: pyvkVY Gir lwfulI mwaUU pIaU KrI ipAwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Payvakarhai Ghari Laadulee Maaoo Peeoo Kharee Piaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: In her mother's home the girl is fondled and dearly loved by parents.

lines.gurmukhi: ivic iBrwvwN BYnVI nwnk dwdk sprvwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Vichi Bhiraavaan Bhainarhee Naanak Daadak Saparavaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: Among the brothers she is a sister and lives joyfully in the full fledged  families of the maternal and the paternal grand fathers.

lines.gurmukhi: lK Krc ivAwhIAY ghxy dwju swju Aiq BwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Lakhaan Kharach Viaaheeai Gahanay Daaju Saaju Ati Bhaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: Then offering  ornaments and dowry etc. and by spending lacs of rupees she is married.

lines.gurmukhi: swhurVY Gir mMnIAY sxKqI prvwr sDwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Saahurarhai Ghari Manneeai Sanakhatee Paravaar Sadhaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: In her father-in-law's house she is accepted as title married wife.

lines.gurmukhi: suK mwxY ipru syjVI CqIh Bojn sdw sIgwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Soukh Maanai Piru Sayjarhee Chhateeh Bhojan Sadaa Seegaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: She  enjoys with her husband, eats variety of foods and always remains bedecked.

lines.gurmukhi: lok vyd guxu igAwn ivic ArD srIrI moK duAwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Lok Vayd Gounu Giaan Vichi Aradh Sareeree Mokh Duaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: From a temporal and spiritual point of view, women is half  man's body and assists to the door of deliverance.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Pl inhcau nwrI ]16]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phal Nihachau Naaree ?16?

Shabad OS B.translation: She assuredly brings  happiness to the virtuous.

lines.gurmukhi: 17 vySvw dy rUpk ivc mnmuK

Shabad OS B.translation: Manmukh,a prostitute

lines.gurmukhi: ijau bhu imqI vysuAw siB kulKx pwp kmwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Bahu Mitee Vaysuaa Sabhi Kulakhan Paap Kamaavai

Shabad OS B.translation: A prostitute having many lovers commits every species of sin.

lines.gurmukhi: lokhu dyshu bwhrI iqhu pKwN kwlMk lgwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Lokahu Daysahu Baaharee Tihu Pakhaan No Aulagu Laavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: An outcast  from her people and her country, she brings disgrace on all the three  sides, i.e. her father's mother's and the family of father-in-law.

lines.gurmukhi: fubI fobY hornw mhurw imTw hoie pcwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Doubee Dobai Horanaa Mahuraa Mitdaa Hoi Pachaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Ruined  herself, she ruines others and still goes on gulping and digesting poison.

lines.gurmukhi: GMfw hyVw imrg ijau dIpk hoie pqMg jlwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Ghandaa Hayrhaa Mirag Jiu Deepak Hoi Patang Jalaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: She is like the musical pipe which lures the deer, or lamp which burns the  moth.

lines.gurmukhi: duhI srweI jrdrU pQr byVI pUr fubwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Duhee Saraaee Jaradaroo Padar Bayrhee Poor Doubaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Due to the sinful activities her face in both the worlds remains pale  because she behaves like a boat of stone which drowns its passengers.

lines.gurmukhi: mnmuK mnu AT KMf hoie dustw sMgiq Brim BulwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Manamoukh Manu Atd Khand Hoi Dousataa Sangati Bharami Bhulaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Similar is the mind of apostate (manmukh), scattered and led astray by superstitions  in the company of evil doers.

lines.gurmukhi: vysuAw puqu innwau sdwvY ]17]
lines.transliteration_english: Vaysuaa Poutu Ninaau Sadaavai ?17?

Shabad OS B.translation: And similar to courtesan's son bearing no  name of his father, the apostate is also not owned by anyone.

lines.gurmukhi: 18 bwlk, jubw, ibrD AvsQw

Shabad OS B.translation: The childhood,the youth and the old age, ,  "

lines.gurmukhi: suiD n hovY bwl buiD bwlk lIlw ivic ivhwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Sudhi N Hovai Baal Budhi Baalak Leelaa Vichi Vihaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Child's wisdom cares not for anything and he passes his time in joyful  activities.

lines.gurmukhi: Br jobin BrmweIAY pr qn Dn pr inMd luBwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Bhar Jobani Bharamaaeeai Par Tan Dhan Par Nid Loubhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: In youthful days, he is attracted by other's body, wealth and  backbiting.

lines.gurmukhi: ibriD hoAw jMjwl ivic mhw jwl prvwru PhwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Biradhi Hoaa Janjaal Vichi Mahaa Jaalu Paravaaru Dhahaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: In old age he is caught in the large web of family affairs.

lines.gurmukhi: bl hIxw miq hIx hoie nwau bhqirAw brVwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Bal Heenaa Mati Heenu Hoi Naau Bahatariaa Bararhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Known to be seventy-two he becomes frail and wisdomless and mumbles in sleep.

lines.gurmukhi: AMnHw bolw ipMglw qnu Qkw mn dhidsu DwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Annhaa Bolaa Pingalaa Tanu Dakaa Manu Dah Disu Dhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Ultimately he turns blind, deaf and lame and though the body  gets tired yet his mind runs in ten directions.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq gur sbd ivxu lK caurwsIh jUin BvwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Gur Sabad Vinu Lakh Chauraaseeh Jooni Bhavaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Without holy congregation  and bereft of Guru-word he transmigrates into infinite species of life.

lines.gurmukhi: Aausru cukw hiQ n AwvY ]18]
lines.transliteration_english: Aousaru Choukaa Hadi N Aavai ?18?

Shabad OS B.translation: The time lost cannot be regained.

lines.gurmukhi: 19 hMs, bgulw, gurmuK, mnmuK

Shabad OS B.translation: swan,crane,gurmukh,manmukh, , , "

lines.gurmukhi: hMs n CfY mwnsr bgulw bhu CpV iPir AwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Hansu N Chhadai Maanasar Bagulaa Bahu Chhaparh Dhiri Aavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The swan never leaves Manasarovar, the sacred tank, but the crane  always comes to the 4irty pond.

lines.gurmukhi: koiel bolY AMb vix vix vix kwau kuQwau suKwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Koil Bolai Anb Vani Vani Vani Kaau Kudaau Soukhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The nightingale sings in the mango  groves but the crow feels comfort at an abominable place in the forest.

lines.gurmukhi: vg n hovin kuqIAw gweIN gorsu vMsu vDwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Vag N Hovani Kouteeaan Gaaeen Gorasu Vansu Vadhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The bitches have no groups. (like cows) and the cows only give milk and  increase the lineage.

lines.gurmukhi: sPl ibrK inhcl mqI inhPl mwxs dh ids DwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Saphal Birakh Nihachal Matee Nihaphal Maanas Dah Disi Dhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The tree full of fruits is stable at one place whereas a  vain person always runs hither and thither.

lines.gurmukhi: Ag qqI jlu sIAlw isru aucw nIvwN idKlwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Agi Tatee Jalu Seealaa Siru Ouchaa Neevaan Dikhalaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The fire is full of heat (of ego) and keeps its head high but the water being cold always goes downward.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK Awpu gvwieAw mnmuKu mUriK Awpu gxwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Aapu Gavaaiaa Manamoukhu Moorakhi Aapu Ganaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukh divests his soul of the egocenteredness but manmukh, the fool  always counts himself (above all).

lines.gurmukhi: dUjw Bwau kudwau hrwvY ]19]
lines.transliteration_english: Doojaa Bhaau Kudaaoun Haraavai ?19?

Shabad OS B.translation: Having sense of duality is not a good conduct, and one always is defeated.

lines.gurmukhi: 20 pMj jMqUAwN duAwrw mnmuK

Shabad OS B.translation: Five creatures and manmukh

lines.gurmukhi: gj miRg mIn pqMg Ail iekqu iekqu roig pcMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Gaj Mrig Meen Patang Ali Ikatu Ikatu Rogi Pachanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Elephant, deer, fish, moth and black bee have one disease each, namely,  attraction for lust, sound, enjoyment, beautiful appearance and fragrance  respectively, and they are consumed by them.

lines.gurmukhi: mwxs dyhI pMij rog pMjy dUq kusUqu krMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Maanas Dayhee Panji Rog Panjay Doot Kousoot Karanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: But the man has all the five  ailments and these five always create turbulences in his life.

lines.gurmukhi: Awsw mnsw fwiexI hrK sog bhu rog vDMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Aasaa Manasaa Daainee Harakh Sog Bahu Rog Vadhanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: The witches  in the form of hope and desires and the happiness and sorrows further  aggravate the diseases.

lines.gurmukhi: mnmuK dUjY Bwie lig BMBlBUsy Kwie BvMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Manamoukh Doojay Bhaai Lagi Bhanbhalabhoosay Khaai Bhavanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Controlled by dualism, the deluded manmukh runs  here and there.

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur scw pwqswh gurmuiK gwfI rwhu clMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Sachaa Paatasaah Guramoukhi Gaadee Raahu Chaladay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The true Guru is the true king and the gurmukhs move on  the highway pointed out by Him.

lines.gurmukhi: swD sMgiq imil clxw Bj gey Tg cor frMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Saadh Sangati Mili Chalanaa Bhaji Gaay Tdag Chor Daranday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Moving along with and in the holy  congregation,

lines.gurmukhi: lY lwhw inij Gir inbhMdy ]20]
lines.transliteration_english: Lai Laahaa Niji Ghari Nibahanday ?20?

Shabad OS B.translation: the theives and cheats in the form of lust for materials run  away.

lines.gurmukhi: 21 siqgur s`cw pwqSwh

Shabad OS B.translation: Guru,the true emperor

lines.gurmukhi: byVI cwiV lMGwiedw bwhly pUr mwxs mohwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Bayrhee Chaarhi Laghaaidaa Baahalay Poor Maanas Mohaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Only one person ferries across many a man.

lines.gurmukhi: AwgU iek inbwihdw lskr sMg swh sulqwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Aagoo Iku Nibaahidaa Lasakar Sang Saah Sulataanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The one commander of the  imperial army gets the whole task executed.

lines.gurmukhi: iPrY mhlY pwhrU hoie inicMd svin prDwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Dhirai Mahalai Paaharoo Hoi Nichind Savani Paradhaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Because of only one  watchman in the locality, all the rich persons sleep free from any  anxiety.

lines.gurmukhi: lwVw iek ivvwhIAY bwhly jw\\\\IN kir imhmwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Laarhaa Iku Veevaaheeai Baahalay Jaaeen Kari Mihamaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Guests in the marriage party remain many but the marriage is solemnised  of one person.

lines.gurmukhi: pwiqswhu ieku mulk ivic horu pRjw ihMdU muslmwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Paatisaahu Iku Mulak Vichi Horu Prajaa Hindoo Mousalamaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The emperor in the country happens to be one and the rest  are the public in the forms of Hindus and Muslims.

lines.gurmukhi: siqguru scw pwiqswhu swDsMgiq guru sbdu nIswxw
lines.transliteration_english: Satiguru Sachaa Paatisaahu Saadhasangati Guru Sabadu Neesaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly the true  Guru Emperor is one and the holy congregation and the Guru word-sabad  are His identification marks.

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur prxY iqn kurbwxw ]21]5]
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Paranai Tin Kurabaanaa ?21?5?

Shabad OS B.translation: I sacrifice myself unto them who seek the  shelter of the true Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: <> siqgur pRswid ]
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: bHmwsn ibsRwm gur Bey gurmuiK sMiD imil
lines.transliteration_english: Brahamaasan Bisraama , Gur Bhaay Gurmukhi Sandhi Mili ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Satguru who resides in Waheguru (Brahm), meeting such Guru-conscious person (Guru Amar Das), and becoming one with him he too acquired all traits of Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK rmqw rwm rwm nwm gurmuiK Bey ]1]5]
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmukhi Ramataa Raama , Raam Naam Gurmukhi Bhaay ?1?5?

Shabad OS B.translation: Through the blessings of Naam Simran of the principal Guru Satguru (Amar Das Ji), Guru Ram Das Ji too became prime Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: gur Bey gurisK sMD imil bHmwsn ibsRwm
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Bhaay Gursikh Sandh Mili , Brahamaasan Bisraam ?

Shabad OS B.translation: In the association of prime Guru (Guru Amar Das Ji) he too became Guru and found refuge in the holy feet of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: rwm nwm gurmuiK Bey gurmuiK rmqw rwm ]2]5]
lines.transliteration_english: Raam Naam Gurmukhi Bhaay , Gurmukhi Ramataa Raam ?2?5?

Shabad OS B.translation: The Guru-conscious person whose name is Ram Das, by perpetual meditation on Lord's name, became Guru-oriented and virtuous (Satguru)

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK rmqw rwm nwm gurmuiK pRgtwieE
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmukhi Ramataa Raama , Naam Gurmukhi Pragataaiao ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Through God-conscious Guru Amar Das Ji and by the blessing of meditation on His name, the virtuous Ram Das emerged as Guru Ram Das (slave of the Lord).

lines.gurmukhi: sbd suriq guru igAwn iDAwn gur gurU khwieE
lines.transliteration_english: Sabad Surati Guru Giaana , Dhiaan Gur Guru Kahaaiao ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Because of knowledge of Guru Shabad and consciously uniting with Him, Guru Ram Das became known as principal Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: dIp joiq imil dIp joiq jgmg AMqir aur
lines.transliteration_english: Deep Joti Mili Deepa , Joti Jagamag Antari Ur ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The flame of a beacon lights up another lamp.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK rmqw rwm sMD gurmuiK imil Bey gur ]3]5]
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmukhi Ramataa Raama , Sandh Gurmukhi Mili Bhaay Gur ?3?5?

Shabad OS B.translation: Thus Guru Ram Das became principal Guru through the blessings of Simran of Lord's name and his association with Guru Amar Das Ji. (5)
